Anglican church: Father Bill Chapman departs parish, but still in service in Hawke’s Bay https://www.nzherald.co.nz/hawkes-bay-today/news/anglican-church-father-bill-chapman-departs-parish-but-still-in-service-in-hawkes-bay/N4B23P534VEELK53UK5L2CEE7A/ https://www.nzherald.co.nz/hawkes-bay-today/news/anglican-church-father-bill-chapman-departs-parish-but-still-in-service-in-hawkes-bay/N4B23P534VEELK53UK5L2CEE7A/ Doug LaingThe parish of the century-old Crownthorpe farewells a unique Father Bill,. Sun, 12 Nov 2023 03:45:40 +0000 Veteran padre Rev Bill Chapman, or Father Bill as he is most-known, is stepping down from parish duties. Photo / Paul Taylor
Nelson homicide: Police name James Whitikau Barton as victim killed in Stoke assault https://www.nzherald.co.nz/nz/nelson-homicide-police-name-person-killed-in-stoke-assualt/ZE27CAC6XJAY3GLTT5NHGGBF3Y/ https://www.nzherald.co.nz/nz/nelson-homicide-police-name-person-killed-in-stoke-assualt/ZE27CAC6XJAY3GLTT5NHGGBF3Y/ Police were called to the scene on Orchard St in Stoke shortly after 7pm on Friday. Sun, 12 Nov 2023 03:21:03 +0000 Police are continuing to investigate and hold those involved responsible for their actions and are confident in the progress made in their enquiries. Photo / NZ Police

New Waiheke ferry service starts tomorrow, months after frustrations boiled over Fullers service https://www.nzherald.co.nz/nz/new-waiheke-ferry-service-starts-tomorrow-months-after-frustrations-boiled-over-fullers-service/EHH4OSZ4TJECLCSLQC5W6J5KZI/ https://www.nzherald.co.nz/nz/new-waiheke-ferry-service-starts-tomorrow-months-after-frustrations-boiled-over-fullers-service/EHH4OSZ4TJECLCSLQC5W6J5KZI/ The operators say excitement has been building since last month's announcement. Cricket: Hawke’s Bay cricket’s big revenge in Rangiorahttps://www.nzherald.co.nz/hawkes-bay-today/news/cricket-hawkes-bay-crickets-big-revenge-in-rangiora/FYH4G4TDXZGNJIYTOVNNVLM3CE/ https://www.nzherald.co.nz/hawkes-bay-today/news/cricket-hawkes-bay-crickets-big-revenge-in-rangiora/FYH4G4TDXZGNJIYTOVNNVLM3CE/ Doug LaingThe Hawke's Bay men's cricket team needed to do something. Photo / HB Cricket

Northland Emergency Services Family Fun Day a massive hit among locals https://www.nzherald.co.nz/northern-advocate/news/northland-emergency-services-family-fun-day-a-massive-hit-among-locals/MGAZQ53MZBDSBHY6JYGB4R5OLE/ https://www.nzherald.co.nz/northern-advocate/news/northland-emergency-services-family-fun-day-a-massive-hit-among-locals/MGAZQ53MZBDSBHY6JYGB4R5OLE/ Kids and adults had fun at the Emergency Services Family Fun Day at Kensington Park. Dad Darcy Wilson and his son Kingston Wilson, 3, from Maungatapere, happily pose in front of a fire truck. Photo / Michael Cunningham
A and P Show: Tie-breaker needed in rare shearing dead-heat https://www.nzherald.co.nz/hawkes-bay-today/news/a-and-p-show-tie-breaker-needed-in-rare-shearing-dead-heat/LMFYVVXHBZD2FJJ7ALKWYL46LY/ https://www.nzherald.co.nz/hawkes-bay-today/news/a-and-p-show-tie-breaker-needed-in-rare-shearing-dead-heat/LMFYVVXHBZD2FJJ7ALKWYL46LY/ Doug LaingHow it was sorted out when two shearers got the same points at CHB show. Sun, 12 Nov 2023 01:08:06 +0000 The historic Open shearing final lineup at the Hawke’s Bay A and P Show on Saturday - where quality points were used as a tie-breaker in a dead-heat on overall points. From left sponsor and Hawke’s Bay farmer Hamish De Lautour, of Primary Wool Co-op, and shearers John Kirkpatrick, David Gordon (the ultimate winner), Jack Fagan and Brook Hamerton. Photo / Shedtalk
